dc_title_s: Bauerkeller's new embossed plan of London, 1841
dc_description_s: Bauerkeller invented a type of relief printing for city maps called "geomontographie." The city blocks with buildings are raised in white, while streets, squares, parks & rivers are printed in colors.  Includes "account of the population of London," and inset showing Isle of Dogs & Greenwich Park.|61 x 109 centimeters|Scale approximately 1:10,560|City Maps
